text:
Welcome to How To Cook That I'm Ann Reardon 
and in this episode I will be debunking videos

that you guys sent me on twitter. Let's start 
with this one sent in by got beef, it says I

never knew this about the inside of oranges ... 
they're in the store with an orange on a drill

then they pull out a blow torch and 
heat the orange. Just not very long.

Then they turn off the blowtorch she tries to 
blow it out and they keep spinning the orange

for a while why are they even doing this? The 
centrifugal force is is pulling it down and

it's done something to the inside of this 
orange and you're going to see what it is.

Wow they made orange jelly hmm pretty impressive, 
let me just bring up the point about centrifugal

force she was saying that that was cooling the 
orange down and changing the inside of the orange.

Centrifugal force is an apparent force that 
appears to pull something away from the center

when it goes on a curved path. Really it's 
actually just the inertia keeping the object

on the path that was going rather than pulling 
away from the center but we call that apparent

force centrifugal force. We can demonstrate 
that by getting James to spin a bucket of water

over his head ... and as you can see 
he doesn't get wet because the force is

keeping the water on the path going round 
the circle so that it doesn't come down

on top of him. So what if we spin an orange 
well as you know oranges don't just have

juice inside as one bucket of water sort of thing 
they have lots of little sacks of juice so that'd

be a bit more like spinning say a bucket full of 
water balloons let's get james to do that as well.

He's such a good sport and as you can see the 
water balloons are not falling out and if we have

a look in the bucket at the end they are also not 
broken they've just stayed intact because they're

just lots of little sections. Now i think that if 
you spun the orange super super super fast like

ridiculously fast you could damage all those 
little membranes inside and maybe turn it into

juice but i don't think this is spinning fast 
enough for one and even if you did make juice

there's no reason for that to gel into jelly 
but as always let's test it out. I'm going

to hit it with a blowtorch for the same 
length of time as they did i'm not going to

show you the whole long process because 
they drew it out for as long as they could

obviously to get the long watch time and then 
i'm going to keep it spinning for the same

amount of time as they did and now after all that 
let's cut the orange in half and inside you have

a normal orange of course. But their video had 
20 million views on facebook which means the

facebook algorithm is promoting that video and 
paying them to do dumb stuff like that. Now if

we go to the actual page that they uploaded it 
on and read the full description right down on

the fourth line it says this ... this was a 
funny magic trick we did in store as a joke.

I don't know i must have different humor to them 
but that information as i said was on the fourth

line which means it doesn't show anywhere that 
the video is it doesn't even show on the page

the videos on unless you click see more and 
most people don't even see that information.

This next video was sent in by morgan who says: 
this video is stupid and dangerous I want to see

what actually happens because I know it isn't 
factual. So she's picked up this is a fake

well done morgan, let's check it out. She puts 
strawberries and razor blades into a container I

can understand why he said it was dangerous and 
shakes them around for a minute and a half to

keep people watching for longer and then finally 
reveals perfectly diced strawberries! Well I agree

morgan this is not going to work but just for you 
I'm going to do it. Firstly hull the strawberries,

now I've got a knife and a chopping board out 
I could of course dice the strawberries while

i'm here but let's not do that let's do the hack. 
Add the razor blades to my strawberries put them

into a container add the lid start a timer 
for a minute and a half and start shaking.

The razor blades are so thin that most of them 
are just sticking flat to the container's edge

as soon as there's any moisture they might as 
well not even be in there but i'll keep shaking

for the full time. As you can see now most of 
the razor blades are still stuck to the edges

and we have not diced the strawberries we've 
basically just smashed them against the sides

of the container and mixed them with the razor 
blades which we now need to find and take out.

There were eight of them so i just need to check 
one two three four five six seven there's another

one in there somewhere let me find that. now once 
again when you go to their actual facebook page so

you can see the full description and click see 
more so you can see that invisible fourth line

it says this page publishes videos are intended 
for entertainment purposes only this includes

scripted dramas satires parodies and magic tricks 
and i assume they think this comes under magic

tricks, you know what i think about that already. 
Anyway let's check out this next one this is from

Ozzies Delight on instagram and it also says it's 
a strawberry hack. When you get your strawberries

do not wash it just remove it from the pack that 
it comes with and store in any glass airtight

jar will do. I've had the strawberries going to 
two weeks and see how fresh they are. Let's test

that out and see if it works this one by the way 
has 27 views not 20 million views, 27 views, so

i'm going to make this fair by taking half of the 
strawberries from each punnett in case one punnett

was more fresh than the other they're both from 
the same store on the same day but just in case

and then i'll put all these other ones into the 
one punnet and put them both in the fridge. Nine

days later and the ones in the punnet look a bit 
dry and old and the ones in the jar still look

brand new plump and perfect. Now i think that 
that is the sort of hack that i'm looking for

hacks that actually work and are helpful to people 
so go give OZZIES DELIGHT i'll put a link to her

instagram post below go give her some love on 
instagram because you know the algorithm isn't

going to because it was helpful it wasn't rubbish. 
Anyway moving on next we have one from tik tok

that was sent to me quite a few times by quite 
a few of you and jen asks is there really enough

pectin in pears to make this work? basically 
they're mixing sparkling lemonade pears salt

and red vinegar bringing it to a boil and once it 
cools down they've got this jelly this pear jelly

thing going on. Now to answer your question jen 
no there's not enough pectin in one pair to set

that amount of liquid i think this is probably a 
matter of lost in translation i think they've got

one ingredient label wrong there but we'll make 
it their way first just to show you what happens

and then I'm gonna swap something out. Put the 
lemonade into a pan add a sliced pear some salt

red wine vinegar bring it to the boil and then 
pour that into a glass. Dave's gonna love that!

While that cools let me make another one with the 
same ingredients except as I said I'm going to

swap out one thing I'm going to take out the salt 
and swap that for agar powder now you need to boil

any solution that you add agar to in order for it 
to gel and I'm not adding vinegar to this one just

because i think it would taste nicer without 
it and it's going to make no difference to the

recipe. Let them both cool and then dave can be 
our taste tester 💕 Do I just drink it like this?

No that was definitely an unexpected hit of 
seawater! This one is the same recipe one

ingredient different. Okay all right let's 
com-pear it. Yeah it's actually okay quite

nice quite fresh light pear flavored jelly good 
one. Now before we move on i just want to say

a huge thank you to everyone who has pre-ordered 
my dessert cookbook, I announced it in the last

episode and i was really nervous i said to Dave 
what if nobody actually wants to buy my cookbook

that i've spent a year writing and then i put the 
video up and all i could see was these comments of

going i've pre-ordered your book i've pre-ordered 
your book and i was so blessed that was just

lovely it was the best thing and 
then i went to bed and then in the

morning i woke up to this ... it was 
sitting at number one best seller in

baking cookbooks in the US and number one in books 
overall on amazon in Australia which was just

crazy! You guys you literally blew me away 💕 So 
to say thank you I want to run a competition for

everyone who pre-orders the book if you haven't 
already pre-ordered it's not too late you can do

that just go to your bookstore that you'd normally 
order from online and type in Ann Reardon and

search for that. I've had lots of questions about 
the quantities, it's in grams and ounces and cups

and centimeters and inches and Fahrenheit and 
centigrade everyone is covered everything is

written both ways so that everybody knows what 
they're doing and you don't have to convert

anything! So hopefully that's good for all of you 
make sure you pre-order and then when you do I'll

put a link to the entry form just underneath this 
video and you can go and enter to win yourself...

one of these amazing Furi knife sets it's got 
all these knives plus that one that's there

that's still in the box that i didn't take out 
and this unbelievable knife block which i just

love. It's wood and it's got magnets in there 
so the knives just sit like that you can either

have them on the outside or you can put them on 
the inside i just prefer them on the outside so

i can see what knives i'm grabbing quickly and 
easily so there's one of those and there are also

five of these beautiful sets as well to give away 
so what you need to do is just pre-order the book

go to the link below to get to the competition 
page and enter for your chance to win one of those

prizes, there's more stuff coming up for people 
who pre-order as well and i'll announce those in

future videos just thank you so much and for those 
of you who wanted to know what's in the book it's

a dessert cookbook and there's a chapter on ice 
creams there's chapter on fun, easy desserts,

pastries, chocolate desserts of course artistic 
desserts there's heaps in there and each chapter

has its own introduction which is a food science 
introduction which explains the science behind

what you're baking so you can get perfect results 
every time! Okay next video this is another tik

tok one and this is showing us how to cook steak 
in a toaster ... now i assume that this probably

should be possible i mean the toaster is a heat 
source so it should work but the question is

why and also is it going to be food safe to then 
use that toaster again for anything else so let's

check it out. Now i set a timer on my phone so i 
could see how long it took and after 20 minutes of

repeatedly putting it down the stake was finally 
hot enough for the rare setting on my thermometer

and the whole toaster was hot to touch i don't 
think it's supposed to be on for that long.

Now i couldn't get it out using (silicon) 
tongs so i had to unplug it and then use

a fork so never use a fork if it's plugged in 
obviously and then let's see what it's like.

It's a bit tough the knife makes this 
look tender but trust me it's not,

the knife is just super sharp. Now my main 
concern is not for the steak it's for the toaster

the tray has uncooked meat juice on it which 
can have a bacteria and i can wash that tray

but i can't wash the inside of the toaster itself 
which also has meat juice in it. Now instead of

going down the path that most tik tokers seem 
to do when they're criticized about a food video

they make they just say this was for entertainment 
purposes only and they add that somewhere in the

fourth line or below of their description 
juliette chose not to do that apparently

in an interview with insider she said this: I 
recommend more people cook with their toaster

my toaster did survive i just cooked shrimp 
yesterday in my toaster and it grilled it

perfectly. Well i would suggest you don't do that 
people and i don't have a stove or an oven only a

coffee maker toaster and hair straightener 
my boyfriend wanted steak for dinner so i

popped the steak in the toaster. I find that very 
interesting that insider didn't follow that up by

watching her other videos because in this video it 
appears like she has a stovetop and an oven. Now

fair enough she could be in a different kitchen 
but if we look at the benchtop in this one it

looks surprisingly similar to the benchtop in the 
toaster with the steak video. Okay moving on this

is called parasites in pork don't like pepsi. They 
basically get pepsi and pour it onto their pork

and then they say these are little 
worms and if we fast forward.

Oh gross! Let me try putting pepsi on pork 
the things we do and let's see what happens

pour on the pepsi and then let's zoom in and 
see if anything comes out. Oh look at that

wow so there's another one ... why is this 
happening let me zoom out and show you why that's

happening. I have a needle going through the paper 
plate and into the pork sitting just under the

surface so i can press out the fat on top and it 
can look a little bit like a worm but it's not a

worm it's just white fat. Personally i think that 
this prank is one of the more dangerous ones to

be shared around the internet and the reason for 
that is because pork parasites are a real thing,

the most commonly known one would be trichonella 
which can cause trichonellosis. what happens if

you eat meat that is infected with the triconella 
larvae is when you eat it and the meat gets

digested the larvae gets released from the meat 
it sits in your intestine for a couple of days and

grows to full size in that time you can get nausea 
and vomiting and diarrhea and feel quite unwell

but then that larvae travels in your bloodstream 
and gets into your muscle tissues where it can

cause an immune response and swelling particularly 
around the eye area and depending where they go to

it can cause very serious illnesses and muscle 
pain and can make you sick for months so they're

showing how to test if your pork has this parasite 
but it's the wrong test! This is not going to

work you could have trichonella larvae in your 
meat pour pepsi on it and you will not see it,

if you want to know if it's in your meat what you 
need to do which is what they do here in Australia

and they do in the US before the meat gets to 
the market so they know if you're buying pork

at the shops it's very very unlikely in the US or 
australia to have this in it they have to puree

the meat up then they digest it using stomach acid 
which is a lot stronger than your pepsi or your

coke and then they keep it warm and agitate it for 
about 20 minutes to digest that meat. They then

pour it into different beakers just to concentrate 
it down and now that fluid there you can see you

can't see any worms in it with the naked eye 
because the larvae are tiny they put it under

a microscope and there you go now you can see the 
little trickinella larvae that were there in that

meat but you would not be able to see it with your 
naked eye even if the pepsi could digest the meat

you will not see it just looking at it, so by 
saying to someone you can test your meat this way

that's not a good thing. There are countries 
where this is a big issue and also for people

if you're in the US the number one cause of 
people getting it there is people hunting their

own meat particularly bears or wild boar and then 
eating it. So if you think you can test your meat

this is not going to work for you. So what you 
need to do is cook it really really well because

heat is going to kill it there's no rare steaks! 
What's next? Five minute craft says if we put

potatoes into a tube with bottle caps attached to 
the top and then spin it with a drill the potato

will be peeled okay let's try that out put the lid 
on spin it around and dip it out and of course our

potatoes are not peeled at all. Bottle caps are 
sharp enough that they could scrape off the potato

peel perhaps if they were all around the inside 
of the tube rather than just on the lid but they'd

be tiny little scrapings not big peelings you get 
when you peel it with a potato peeler. I was also

sent this five minute crafts video as well where 
they get a plate and they cut a zigzag pattern out

of the plate and they use it to put a pattern on 
the side of the cake and on the top two but then

all of a sudden the pattern goes from the really 
small zigzags that were on our paper to these huge

zags that are now on the cake and they add 
sprinkles on top. Now i'm not sure why they

faked this because technically it should work it's 
just icing and it's just a piece of cardboard it

wouldn't be my first choice for what to use 
if you didn't have a proper cake scraper

but let's try it and see if we can get it to work 
... it's not great the first time around but if

i repeat it at the same spot a few times we can 
make it smoother. A better hack would be to cut an

ice cream container lid because it's much firmer 
it's not as flimsy as the plate and it gives you

a much sharper pattern on the cake. You will need 
to go across it several times so here is the side

done with the paper plate and here is the side 
done with the ice cream lid, i'll just quickly

run the ice cream lid the whole way around 
the cake so that it is even and there we go,

done. Michelle thank you for sending in this 
next one also by five minute crafts they put

sugar into a fry pan and turn on the heat and 
that looks burnt and then they put a different

looking number five on top of the cake let's 
look at those side by side 🧐 This is not the

method i would use to make a sugar five at all 
but i will do it their way and see what happens.

Arrange some sugar into a number five shape turn 
on the heat and let it melt then once it's cold

try and get it off the pan, now it is of course 
stuck because sugar really sticks to things well

and it has broken. If you look at the pieces 
anyway it is quite dark and if i taste it it

tastes burnt. Now here is how i would suggest you 
do that if you want a sugar number on top of your

cake put sugar into a pan and add enough water to 
make it wet then turn on the heat and stir until

the sugar is dissolved wash down the sides of the 
pan using a wet pastry brush this is important to

get any sugar crystals off the sides and then let 
it boil unstirred until it's just starting to turn

golden it goes from golden to burnt very quickly 
so pull it off the heat. now pour that onto a

non-stick baking paper in the shape of a five you 
should have enough there to make a few so you can

choose your favorite one. once it's cool it just 
peels off the baking paper and you can add it to

the top of your cake. With thanks to my patrons 
for your support every month here is a list of

absolute legends if you liked this video make sure 
you let the algorithm know by liking commenting

sharing subscribing and watching more of my videos 
don't forget to enter the competition to win the

Furi knives and pre-order my cookbook so exciting! 
Make it a great week and I'll see you on friday 😁
